briefdescription.para: Check if a CUDA device is available at runtime.

detaileddescription.para: This attempts to initialize the CUDA runtime and query the number of devices. When the code is compiled without CUDA support (IE_WITH_CUDA!=1), this returns IE_CUDA_UNAVAILABLE.

simplesect.para: IE_CUDA_OK if at least one device is present; IE_CUDA_UNAVAILABLE otherwise; IE_CUDA_ERR_RUNTIME on CUDA API failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, const float *x, float *y, int rows, int cols, int ldw_e, size_t row_stride_bytes)
memberdef.name: ie_cuda_gemv_f32_strided

briefdescription.para: Convenience that also accepts strides in bytes.

detaileddescription.para: Same as ie_cuda_gemv_f32 but allows a byte-stride for W. Useful if the host matrix is subviewed or padded in bytes.

parameterdescription.para: Distance in bytes from W[r,0] to W[r+1,0]. If 0, computed as ldw_e*sizeof(float).

simplesect.para: IE_CUDA_OK on success or an error code.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, const float *x, float *y, int rows, int cols, int ldw)
memberdef.name: ie_cuda_gemv_f32

briefdescription.para: Run y = W * x using a native CUDA kernel (FP32).

detaileddescription.para:
Layout:
W is row-major with leading dimension ldw (ldw >= cols).
x is a length-cols vector.
y is a length-rows vector (output).

Semantics:
Allocates device buffers, copies W and x H2D, launches kernel, copies y D2H, and frees device buffers. This is correctness-first. We can add persistent allocations in a later iteration.

Preconditions:
All pointers must be non-NULL.
rows > 0, cols > 0, ldw >= cols.

parameterdescription.para: Host pointer to row-major matrix of shape (rows, cols).
Host pointer to vector of shape (cols).
Host pointer to output vector of shape (rows).
Number of rows in W / y length.
Number of cols in W / x length.
Leading dimension of W in elements (>= cols).

simplesect.para: IE_CUDA_OK on success; see return codes above otherwise.

briefdescription.para: CUDA backend implementation: device availability + FP32 GEMV kernel.

detaileddescription.para: This TU compiles with NVCC when IE_WITH_CUDA=1 and provides a minimal, dependency-free GEMV path. It favors clarity and correctness; later we can add persistent buffers and streams.

sect2.title: Kernel strategy
sect2.para: One thread-block computes one output row (y[r] = dot(W[r,*], x)). Each thread accumulates a partial sum over K with grid-stride loops, then we reduce within the block to a single float and write y[r].

listitem.para: Error handling wraps CUDA runtime calls and returns negative codes.
